intro: Matucana hastifera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated for its decorative foliage and as a source of starchy roots.
